website_summaries.verdict: The Logitech M705's adaptive laser sensor and sculpted body will make your wrist happy for less than the cost of a few lattes.
pros: The M705 wireless mouse has a contoured shape that fits the natural ergonomics of your hand
Its Unifying Receiver makes it easy to pair with any computer (along with other Logitech peripherals), and the laser sensor offers precise, smooth scrolling across most surfaces
cons: Users with large hands may feel cramped on the surface of the mouse

customer_reviews.title: No where near the description
customer_reviews.text: So the pictures item is the original Logitech mouse. The one they send you is a different version same mode number. I bought this cause that’s the mouse we use at my work and wanted the same for myself. When it arrived the logo was totally different. Kind of new I guess. But the function was no ware near the same. The back button on the side does not work. Also the layout of the sliding pads on the bottom are different making it harder to navigate on the screen
customer_reviews.author: Mr. San Diego

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Not the same model as in the picture. Feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Slimmer

customer_reviews.title: NOT UNIFYING SOFTWARE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse as a replacement for an M705 that came as part of the MK710 combo kit. My mouse from the kit is an M705. This is NOT the same mouse. It is missing the lower thumb button, so select different desktops or recent apps/files. It is ALSO MISSING the ability to use it with any other unifying devices. I tried to use the new mouse and unifying receiver, and add my existing keyboard, but it would not recognize at all. Went back to my old receiver and mouse, and it is all connected. Now I have to either figure out how to get my left click to work, or order the whole now MK710 combo.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Hankey

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: It's noisy. The left button makes a "sproing" sound releasing a click. The right button is overly sensitive and triggers from the mere weight of my finger. An unwanted fast scroll occasionally occurs, for no reason at all. It's as though this mouse has a mind of its own. There is a very sharp corner on the edge of the shiny side trim. What has happened to the Logitech quality I used to know and love? Oh, and they changed this model (eliminating a thumb button), but kept the old model number. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Goober

customer_reviews.title: Not the Item Pictured.
customer_reviews.text: I experienced the same issue. I was looking for the original with the bottom thumb button. It is not the same mouse pictured. I wish I would have read these posts. I bought 4 of them. The scroll is horrible. When you move the mouse it scrolls your page up and down. Very unbalanced. I have purchased looking for that same mouse on many listings and still get the same outcome, right photo, Wrong Mouse.
customer_reviews.author: The Ontiveros Group

customer_reviews.title: I love this awesome mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has a nice weight to it and a smooth feel in my hand. It's comfortable to hold and looks stylish. All I had to do is put in the batteries that came with it and plug in the USB into my computer and that's it. It's wireless and I can use it anywhere in the room. It's sturdy and very well made. I can use it on my desk with or without a mouse pad and its very accurate. It's programable and the batteries will last 3 years. It's reasonably priced and works better than other computer mice within the same price range. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ava Joy Porter

customer_reviews.title: Quality Mouse-But It's a Logitech
customer_reviews.text: I owned this exact model before but it stopped working due to my abuse - Rage-Quiting while gaming.....smh. Anyway I replaced it with some off-brand from a local retailer and sorely missed it. I was happy to find it here at Amazon. I don't need to say that this is a good mouse. I think most agree that if it's a Logitech, it's quality. What I like most about this mouse is how it feels in my hands. I think its the greater width as compared to the junk I had before. Never stray from Logitech, or victimize it when rage-quiting your games.
customer_reviews.author: John Q Public

customer_reviews.title: Same model number, different mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is my 6th M705. Battery life is amazing and previous examples had a long life or are still working. I saw the negative reviews and should have listened. The oversized teflon feet on the previous devices are now replaced with _nothing_, just hard plastic, and the mouse works very poorly on all of my mouse pads. Logitech should never have kept the old model number given this level of cheapening.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Thaden

customer_reviews.title: Makes navigating code a breeze
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse for two simple reasons: the forward and back buttons (extremely useful while coding) and the unlockable scroll wheel for fast scrolling through super long files or web pages. It also holds up; the one I use at work is just as sturdy as the day I started using it a year and a half ago, and who knows whether I was even the first one to use it?
customer_reviews.author: FuegoFiddle

customer_reviews.title: Not what is pictured nor what is said to be "What's In the box"
customer_reviews.text: As stated in previous reviews, this product is NOT what is pictured. While both, what is pictured & what was recieved(sold), are in fact M705s the pictured is the coveted M/N M-R0009 with more features and better quality. However, what is sold to you is the M/N M-R0073 which is the price point, scaled down version. This model M-R0073(sold) does not have all features and more importantly, NOT compatible with Logitech's Setpoint mouse software.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Quality is a little shabby...
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for almost a year now (bought this February, 2018). Everything worked well for the first 6 months. But things went south. First, the USB unifying receiver failed. The USB contacts became intermittent. Had to look for a replacement. Then the "hyper-fast" scrolling became loose. When the scrolling wheel was unlocked, moving the mouse fast would unintentionally scroll the screen. So had keep the scroll wheel locked (defeating the purpose of "hyper-scroll").
customer_reviews.author: Navaho

customer_reviews.title: Too bad you can't choose your frequency.
customer_reviews.text: The previous Logitech Wireless Marathon Mouse M705 we had came with a keyboard. That one didn't last very long (not even a year). We found this one and it is identical except for the frequency. The problem is, we have a dongle for the keyboard, which works fine, and now have to use an extra USB for the mouse. That is why it didn't get FIVE Stars.
customer_reviews.author: PAE

customer_reviews.title: Very economic but feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a ten year old vx mouse I was looking for something similarly shaped and this one is almost an exact clone of that great performing mouse. That said it feels really flimsy and it’s definitely not as solid. The fast scroll knob feels loose and the clocks are not very satisfying. Best way to describe it to sit in a Honda and play with the switch gear, then sit in a GM. You immediately see and feel the difference. I just hope it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: dbvolfan1

customer_reviews.title: Poor connection - don't bother
customer_reviews.text: I have had Logitech products for decades and I just replaced a MX Performance mouse with the M705 because the rechargeable battery on the performance mouse was no longer charging well. The connection between the PC and the mouse is via the unifying USB receiver - it is abysmal. The curser 'hangs', refuses to move or is sluggish. I'll be throwing this mouse away - don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Pixie

customer_reviews.title: Scrolling: It works after all!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great! If you find you're dissatisfied with the lack of tactile feedback from the scrolling wheel and about to write a negative review about it, try pushing the button in the middle of the top of the mouse. I had completely not realized this button was there for a while, and it makes a huge difference in how satisfying the scroll wheel is to use for me.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: This was something I expected from Logitech.
customer_reviews.text: This product is bad. It feels very plastic and it's too big for my hands. I expect this product to have its own integrated battery and not be using Durrecel Battery. This is the future and not the past. The batteries makes the product more junkie and they intend to shake around while you lift them. It's annoying to hear them jiggle inside. The two buttons on the left doesn't work. I feel them pointless. The green light doesn't appear that much when it supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Olufemi Williams

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! So nice.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best mouse I have ever used. Its so fast and the little wheel moves so much faster and easier than my old basic logitech mouse. I definitely will stay with this model for a long time. The last one lasted me around 6 years, maybe more idk, so i am hoping this one will last as long.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Laser sensor not in middle of mouse - bad tracking
customer_reviews.text: The laser sensor that track the mouse’s movement is placed very poorly. It is towards the outer edge of the mouse, well away from the center. This causes bad tracking, especially if your use wrist motions versus moving your entire arms. When I move the mouse side to side, the cursor on screen moves slightly upwards instead of directly side to side. YMMV but these seems to be poor design and leads to frustration
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: I can't tell you exactly how long a battery lasts in this thing - but using it 8+ hours a day in my office for what seems like a
customer_reviews.text: Although this mouse feels a little cheap compared to my other Logitech mice (Anywhere MX and MX Master) - it is a champion in its own right. I can't tell you exactly how long a battery lasts in this thing - but using it 8+ hours a day in my office for what seems like a year now and I have not yet had to change the battery. I cannot say that about any of my other mice - despite their long battery life claims. If you are looking for a relatively inexpensive, solid mouse that will run for a very long time without changing batteries - this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pellegrini

customer_reviews.title: The price is right for a technology that works well!
customer_reviews.text: I got this wireless mouse for my nephew who's studying at Cal Poly, Pomona, CA. and he seems to like it very much for the battery life and other special features. The carrier did not call or text him to what/where "secured place" he left it on campus, but my nephew finally got it the next day. LSS, Mililani, HI
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected or desired
customer_reviews.text: I needed a replacement for my M705 that was part of my wireless keyboard and mouse purchase from years ago. well now I have to use the usb fob from the mouse AND the usb fob for the keyboard to make my setup work. Totally disappointed, but I need a mouse. so I limp along. The product logo does not match the original Logitech mouse, is this bait and switch? Probably, but who knows. 3 year battery life? They send you duracell looking batteries with a foriegn language on them.
customer_reviews.author: RKW

customer_reviews.title: Didn't communicate with my Logitech keyboard.  Had to return.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse, but it didn't communicate with my Logitech keyboard and I had to return it. I'm thankful that Amazon provided free return on this item. I had to buy a combo keyboard and mouse in order for it to work together.
customer_reviews.author: L. Yuen

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well. Lags just a little at times
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a long range mouse. Works pretty well. Lags just a little at times. The only complaint I have so far is the scrolling wheel. It is almost too loose and scrolls way farther than I want. If you scroll it down really fast, it just keeps going.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Thomas

customer_reviews.title: NOT AN ORIGINAL MOUSE (NOT THE SAME AS ON PICTURE)
customer_reviews.text: As someone mentioned already this is not an original M705. NO thumb button, NO original logo. BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE VERSION PICTURED
customer_reviews.text: I ordered from this listing specifically because the picture showed that it was the original M705 model. This version is the updated version, meaning it doesn't have the thumb button, and the pads are made of hard plastic. You might as well order directly from Amazon and save yourself a few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed. Can finally post how long the battery life ...
customer_reviews.text: Not disappointed. Can finally post how long the battery life ACTUALLY was. Didn't believe the claim, so I made a point of verifying. So here it is: 1,044 day battery life out of 1,095 days it was suppose to last. Only and month and a half shy of 3 years. I'll take it. And I'd buy it again. Mouse is used from my easy chair, 10' away from the desktop; flat-screen on the wall used as the monitor. Mouse is often dropped on to the hardwood floor from the arm of the easy chair. Always works, ZERO issues.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen r helgeson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wireless mouse for any use
customer_reviews.text: Fits the (right) hand very well. Batteries last more than a year. Sleeps to reduce power drain when not in use. And the extra buttons are essential. I use them for back (page in browser, folder in Explorer) and minimize window.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Fits great in my right hand and survives innumerable drops to the floor.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse fits perfectly in my right hand. A feature I especially like is the buttons within thumb's reach. I can select which action I want each button to do (e.g., one copies, another pastes, another cuts ... ). It saves time rather than pressing <Ctrl>C, <Ctrl>V, and <Ctrl>X, respectively, but these are just three of the many options the M705 offers as actions available with one click of a button.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. JSH

customer_reviews.title: I like this mouse and the free scroll wheel is something ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this mouse and the free scroll wheel is something I have grown used to and really like. It's comfortable to use and I like that you can put the dongle in the mouse itself while travelling. However, there is a slight annoyance. In free scroll mode, the while tends to roll forward, making the web page scroll up. This can be very annoying. Not sure if it's the wheel or the balance is out, but I have to change it to 'grip' mode to keep things in place. Otherwise, it's a really nice mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Leigh

customer_reviews.title: 4th one of these I bought
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. I wish that Logitech had a Bluetooth version of it. The middle mouse roller that can either roll fast or roll in discrete steps is the best feature of this mouse by far. Back and forward buttons are perfectly located. I'll keep buying this hoping for the Bluetooth version someday.
customer_reviews.author: gwiz

customer_reviews.title: Not the same mouse
customer_reviews.text: Not sure whats going on but apparently Logitech changed the design of their mouse to some cheap plastic without the thumb button. Image on this listing is not the mouse you will receive.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Very responsive but I had a bit of a problem with the dongle. To make it work with another one side by side I needed to check which was which. But otherwise no problem. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Keylard

customer_reviews.title: The Ideal Laptop Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is an ideal laptop mouse since it is small, stores the "dongle" inside the mouse when not in use, gets phenomenal battery life from one AA Lithium battery (nearly a year) and has a thumb button which can easily be programmed (I use double-click). Personally I find the built-in laptop track pads a nuisance since graphic editing with it is two buttons short of dismal (-2 on a scale of 1-10). They are only better than a mouse when you don't have a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk P.

customer_reviews.title: The Ever Reliable M705
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a M705 which was on the way out after years of use. Its precise, ergonomically comfortable. Plug the receiver into a USB port, wait a minute or so and your good to go. It synchronized to the wireless keyboard as well with no problem. Brand new in its blister pack at a very good price.. Battery life is very long.
customer_reviews.author: Ken T

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse under $50
customer_reviews.text: One of these best computer Mice besides the MX Master. Everyone in our office uses these. Hyper scroll is very useful and the battery life is very long. Unfortunately the Logitech software did not work on my Windows 7 computer for a while. But windows 10 it works fine. Love the custom button feature. This mouse also works very well with Apple Computers
customer_reviews.author: George T

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, comfortable mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this mouse for years and it finally gave up the ghost so I ordered two more to insure I will have one for years. Ergonomically great for me - no pain, no stiffness, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless mouse on the market
customer_reviews.text: The ergonomics of this mouse are perfect for man hands. It just feels great for all day use. Its way more comfortable than a slim mouse or a huge gaming mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Ruffell

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with DVR security systems
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to have extended range on my video security DVR. Does not work at all... I guess I'll use it with one of my other computer systems. If I'd had known that, I wouldn't have purchased it! Didn't need another mouse, especially a pricy one! Only works with Windows 7, 8, 10.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba Gump

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Don't use it for gaming but I like the feel of it in my hands and the location of the buttons. Wasn't aware of the sleep mode function...but as long it doesn't waste batteries....
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 9 months =\
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 9 months of moderate abuse. One of the plastic clips that holds the mouse buttons level (they clip in so the plastic keeps its shape) broke off. Kinda surprised that this one broke first, I have one from 2011 that's been through much worse and it just keeps chugging. I might be able to fix it with a shim, but the buttons will be uneven =\
customer_reviews.author: LSieber

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mouse, and I do recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Very nice mouse, and I do recommend it. My one minor complaint is that my earlier one that finally died seemed heavier and more sturdy, which I liked. But on the other hand I had to recharge that one every few weeks, and this one (theoretically) can go for years on a battery charge. Color me happy!
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Too good
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. I lost my old one and got this one to replace it. Other mouses don't seem good anymore, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse at a nice price
customer_reviews.text: I really love this mouse. I ditched my corded mouse from work and bought one of these. I've have my home one for a couple of years now. Fits my hand nicely, feels solid (not a cheap POS), easy to use on most surfaces. The Unifying dongle allows multiple Logitech wireless devices (mice, keyboards) to sync with only one dongle in place. Nicely done.
customer_reviews.author: BigAl

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouse for several years now.... still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. Used it for Windows... just got a Macbook Pro and it works with that too. Had the mouse a couple of years. Can't believe I hadn't recommended it yet. Love my Logitech keyboard that I've had equally as long, too K350. Macbook Pro found it as well. Forgot these even need batteries... rarely ever have to replace. Happy not to have to shop for new mouse or keyboard because I really really like these.
customer_reviews.author: Tell it like it is

customer_reviews.title: Great for the environment.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the long life battery and for this it's great. Its quality is good enough but I must admit I was expecting something slightly more solid in feel.
customer_reviews.author: Señor Pavo

customer_reviews.title: There are different M705 mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is the cheaper mouse It does not have the thumb button which is what I did order.I paid $28.95 for the better mouse not $20.99 the mouse that was sent to Mexico
customer_reviews.author: jimmyanne

customer_reviews.title: Logitech got rid of the thumb button
customer_reviews.text: they got rid of the thumb button. usefulness of the product took a dive. now it uses the garbage "logitech options" desktop app, rather than a tray app, that is not nearly as intuitive and updates constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Meaghan Rachor

customer_reviews.title: I've used it every day at work for over a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used it every day at work for over a year and have never had to change the battery so I think it must be immortal. No synch issues. I do recall the sensitivity feeling a bit off when I first started using it but I got used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not like as described!
customer_reviews.text: Worst mouse i have even held (even compared to the cheap ones), the wheel is a disaster and there is no thumb button as advertised, stay away from this!
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Baidas

customer_reviews.title: Failure after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I got this mouse in Jan 2012 and the scroll wheel started acting up in June of 2012. The scroll wheel was always a bit sensitive but it started causing web pages to jump up and down. In some application that use the scroll wheel to rotate through selections it was almost impossible to select the right item. I called Logitech support and they sent me a replacement, which is good, but it took almost a month We will see how long this one lasts. Irony: One really cool feature of this mouse is the batteries last 3 years. I wonder if I will every see the day this mouse lasts as long as its batteries. :-|
customer_reviews.author: DeusExKing

customer_reviews.title: It really did 3 years on the original batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse on June 4, 2015. I am happy to report that the original batteries are still working as advertised. I use this mouse every day for 3-4 hours and it has held up well. I am very happy with this mouse and think most other people would be too.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't need a mouse with tons of extra buttons or functionality so this mouse fit the bill perfectly. Built well, fits nicely in your hand and has good battery life at a nice price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: hot mouse
customer_reviews.text: This M705 mouse has been...is and will always be a great mouse. enough said!
customer_reviews.author: boeing711

customer_reviews.title: This mouse is fantastic, heavy enough that it feels like it has ...
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is fantastic, heavy enough that it feels like it has some substance to it but not too heavy for me. My last mouse from Logitech lasted me 6 years so I am just hoping that this one is the same. I have not had to change the batteries yet after a few months of use which is more than I can say about my last mouse. I LOVE the scroll wheel modes with free scroll or click scroll. It took me some time to get used to having the backwards and forwards button on one side but it is fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Great for DAW's..!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I have two - one for my home studio and another in my bag to work with my laptop. The extra keys are great (except for the quick roll on/off, I'd rather just not have that function), and I use them a lot while working with Reaper / Abelton Live and such.
customer_reviews.author: Amit Eshbal

customer_reviews.title: My total favorite.
customer_reviews.text: I use one for my desktop and my laptop. Always works well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Wild

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Fiance's laptop. He uses is for gaming and work and loves it! Its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Astorga

customer_reviews.title: Logitech has designed the perfect mouse
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable and portable. The tiny dongle is nice to install and forget about. The battery conservation is incredibly smart - my battery lasted for years before I had to replace it. It's also pretty sturdy - I just stick it in my backpack with no sort of protection whatsoever and have only once had to pop the buttons back into place. And the back/forward thumb buttons make web browsing so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: ferret

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 now and as long as they continue to make it'll be our go-to mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: turned into cheap horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Previous gen of the same mouse was solid and well built. The new one is cheap, flimsy, plasticy. Buttons stick. Buttons don't sit flush on the mouse and causes the right button to click together as they overlap. Much lighter. Overall, you can see the clear amount of cost cutting that has affected the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: TheScrubbiePeopleUSA

customer_reviews.title: Good fit - long battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few different mice but this one has the best feel in my hand. I suppose it would not work nearly as well for a left handed user but it works great for me. I use it with Linux and Windows and it seems to work fine with either. I like mine so much, I bought one for my wife who works at a computer all day. (I do as well, writing code for various things.)
customer_reviews.author: H. Barta

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse for this price
customer_reviews.text: It not moving slicky on any surface and its something moving inside if you shake it a little. Overall exellent mouse, ergonomic, sleep mode, off button, 2 scrolling modes have all you need for work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: useful for both work and play
customer_reviews.text: Never worry bout battery life once set, and love horizontal scrolling by tilting wheel. actually it's my third m705. great products.
customer_reviews.author: hilary

customer_reviews.title: Durable and very comfortable in the hand
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value! The unit is in my knapsack and goes everywhere with me. It's accurate and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Previtera

customer_reviews.title: Best general purpose mouse, only lasts for over a year.
customer_reviews.text: Logitech has some problem with dust eventually getting into the finer electronics inside, which can sort of get repaired and cleaned out. Otherwise, you will need to replace it after a year or so of daily use. Would give five stars otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great multipurpose mouse. The sensitivity is really accurate and smooth. Works on any surface I tried it on. The quality and service was great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: One year going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe it's been a year since I bought this mouse and I am still on the same pair of batteries. I know, I know, the title clearly states three years but I just couldn't help but reiterate. This mouse is comfortable for me to use on a regular basis (keep in mind I have relatively small hands). The continuous scroll wheel takes a bit to get used to, but now I love it. With a little custom button configuration, this mouse is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: G. T. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: The best one as far as battery consumption is concerned
customer_reviews.text: The best one as far as battery consumption is concerned. It lasts a long time. I had a Microsoft Mouse and I am not going to buy it ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jayaram Krishnaswamy

customer_reviews.title: This is a best-selling mouse for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: The comfortable shape, great-feeling buttons, small receiver, and simple configuration software all make this a great mouse. I have medium-sized hands and may have liked something slightly bigger, but this is plenty comfortable as-is, and is easy to carry in a small laptop bag. Works great with my Mac and is easy to change the button behavior. I've only had this mouse for a month, but it's worked well and I'd happily buy another if I ever need to.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wegman

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this mouse. It tracks well on almost any surface, is small and easy to carry around, and doesn't require installing any special software. It's not too small though, and fits comfortably in my hand. The scroll wheel can be adjusted, and works great for me, allowing super fast yet precise scrolling. The battery also last forever, and since the dongle is small, I just leave it plugged into my laptop. Logitech is also a great company with good support, so I highly recommend this mouse!
customer_reviews.author: MagicalMule

customer_reviews.title: Slowest mouse I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Nice feeling mouse. Good size for a smaller hand. Horrible response time. I bought this to replace my older Razer Orachi Bluetooth mouse when the Razer's glide surface began to show wear. But even without the pads on the bottom of the Razer it runs rings around the new Logitech. It came in the antithesis of frustration free packaging too, so returning it isn't even an option.
customer_reviews.author: MurfUnit

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Nice mouse! Good size and a comfortable fit for me. It has excellent response time and is easy to install. I highly recommend it.

product_meta.title: Logitech Wireless Marathon Mouse M705 with 3-Year Battery Life
product_meta.description:
Logitech Marathon Mouse M705 let you power on and on. It uses less than half the power of comparable mice, so you'll go up to three full years between battery changes.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



Sculpted design and integrated thumb buttons for on-the-go comfort and control.

Logitech Marathon Mouse M705
Click and go for years without battery changes
Having a wireless mouse is all about convenience. You want to check email, click through web pages, and scroll through spreadsheets anywhere you like—without wire clutter or a second thought. The only problem is your mouse may be a bit power hungry, causing you to change batteries more often than you expected. That's where Logitech's new Marathon Mouse M705 can simplify your mobile life. 


One set of included AA batteries gives you up to 3 years of dependable power without battery changes. 

Power on with up to three years of battery life 
Say goodbye to the hassle, expense, and waste of frequent battery changes. Your new mouse uses less than half the battery power of comparable wireless mice. It's so energy efficient, you won't even have to think about replacing the batteries for years. And since you'll be using and disposing fewer batteries, you'll be doing a good thing for the planet, too.



One tiny Unifying receiver stays in your notebook and connects up to six compatible devices in different places.

Take comfortable control 
The first time your hand rests on the Marathon Mouse M705, you'll know there's more going on here than a simple point and click. The compact, sculpted shape guides your hand naturally into place, giving you effortless mouse control that's oh-so comfortable wherever you go. Plus, three integrated thumb buttons are right where you need them to move more quickly between web pages and applications.

Different setups. Different locations. One tiny Logitech Unifying receiver.
The Logitech Unifying receiver is part of a new family of products that brings you wireless freedom and convenience without the hassle of multiple receivers. It's easy to pair up to six Unifying compatible devices, all to the same tiny receiver that never needs to leave your laptop. Now it's even more convenient to move around and work at the office, at home or on the road. Create the combo that works for you. See other products that work with Logitech Unifying receiver.


Fly through long documents with a spin of the hyper-fast scroll wheel.

Scroll there at hyper-fast speed 
You set the pace. A single spin of the scroll wheel helps you fly through long documents, presentations and web pages to find what you need in a flash. Or you can to shift to click-by-click mode for precise line-by-line navigation of lists, slides or images. 



Compact size is easy to take along for precise laser tracking on most surfaces.

Track all over with laser precision 
No cursor lag or jitters. The Logitech Marathon Mouse M705 is designed with advanced laser tracking to give you ultra-smooth, responsive and accurate cursor control. And because you work and play in different places, this mouse does, too—even on surfaces where optical mice typically don't work, like a polished wood desk.
